What You\'ll Need: You\'ll Also Like • DSLR or manual camera\n• 24mm wide angle lens\n• Tripod Identify the right aperture for your scene\'s depth of field to achieve the best clarity. Use a narrower aperture so that the entire scene remains in focus. Frame the subject of your landscape by making use of the lines and angles present in your scene. Look out for curves, textures, triangles, thirds, and other shapes that improve your composition. Find the time of the day with the best light conditions for your scene. Balance the light sources in your composition so that both light and shadows are present, adding depth, texture, and scale to your landscape.
